{"py/object": "helper.questionhelper.Question", "qid": 1, "marks": "9", "qText": "Write a program to find out the 5 closest gas-stations to a given location (given as a longitude,latitude pair). The gasstation data is available in the gasstations folder in largedatasets. A small code snippet for adding your location and converting it into a geodataframe is provided", "qType": "4", "qImageDetails": null, "results": {"options": null, "choice": "import geopandas as gpd
import pandas as pd
name = 'CWRU'
mylocation = (41.504,-81.608) #location of case western. Feel free to change the location. Make sure the data is in latitude,longitude format
dframe = pd.DataFrame([[name,mylocation[0],mylocation[1]]],columns=['name','latitude','longitude'])
mylocationGeo = gpd.GeoDataFrame(dframe,geometry=gpd.points_from_xy(dframe.longitude,dframe.latitude),crs='EPSG:4326')
#now write your code here to find out the 5 closest gas stations to mylocationGeo"}}
